meanings.definition: Having a mutual relationship or connection
meanings.sent1: The two friends had a correlational bond that lasted for years.
meanings.sent2: The correlational nature of their friendship was evident in their constant support for each other.
meanings.sent3: It was quite correlational how their tastes in music always seemed to match.
meanings.sent4: Their correlational friendship was like two puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The correlational bond between the siblings was unbreakable.

meanings.definition: Involving or showing a relationship between two or more variables
meanings.sent1: The correlational study revealed a strong link between exercise and heart health.
meanings.sent2: Researchers found a correlational pattern between study time and exam scores.
meanings.sent3: It was correlational how the rise in temperature correlated with the increase in ice cream sales.
meanings.sent4: The correlational data painted a clear picture of the relationship between income and education level.
meanings.sent5: The correlational analysis highlighted the connection between sleep quality and mood.
